bibl.title: Letter from Joseph B. Brown to the Surgeon General, February 12, 1875

div1.p: Brown recommends Reed's appointment as Assistant Surgeon, US Army, but notes that Reed's acquaintance with general literature and science is not up to the expected standard. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Joseph B. Brown to the Surgeon General, February 12, 1875
div1.opener:
Army Medical Board,
Army Building Cor. Greene & Houston Sts.,
New York, February 12, 1875.
Surgeon General, U.S. Army.
Sir:-
div1.p:
Dr. Walter Reed was wholly examined
and found qualified for appointment as
Asst. Surgeon, U.S. Army. It is respectfully
recommended that Dr. Reed be admonished
that his acquaintance with general literature
and science was not up to the expected
standard, and that he will be required
to make good the deficiency, before his
second examination.
div1.closer:
Very Respectfully,
Your Obt. Servt.,
(Signed.) Joseph B. Brown, Surgeon, U.S. Army.
President Board.
Official:-
C. H. Crane
Asst. Surgeon General,
U.S. Army.
S. G.. Office,
Mch. 18, 1882.
